org.eng.aisp.util

Class PCMUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.util.PCMUtil

  • public class PCMUtil
extends Object
    Provides utilities for working with raw sounds samples (PCM) in MP3 and WAV formats. WAV files supported are signed 8-, 16-, 24- and 32-bit signed little-endian values.
    Author:
    dawood
    See Also:
    http://soundfile.sapp.org/doc/WaveFormat/

    • Method Detail

      • pcm2Double

        public static double[] pcm2Double(byte[] samples,
                                  int channels,
                                  int bitsPerSample)
        Convert an array of PCM samples to an array of double values scaled to -1..1.
        Parameters:
        samples - signed pcm values (yes, even if 8 bit samples).
        channels - the number of channels present in the samples.
        bitsPerSample - 8, 16,24, or 32.
        Returns:
        An array of length samples.length / (bitsPerSample/8) / channels. If more than one channel then the result is the average of the separate channel signals.

        public static void PCMtoWAV(String fileName,
                            byte[] data,

                            int channels,
                            int bitsPerSample)
                     throws IOException
        Write the pcm file to the given file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - if .wav extension is not included it will be added.
        data - raw unsigned PCM data in little-endian order.
        srate -
        channels -
        bitsPerSample -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • PCMtoWAV

        public static void PCMtoWAV(OutputStream os,
                            byte[] pcmData,
                            int srate,
                            int channels,
                            int bitsPerSample)
                     throws IOException
        Deprecated. in favor of PCMtoWAV(OutputStream, byte[], int, int, int, int) to set the dimensions.
        A convenience on PCMtoWAV(OutputStream, byte[], int, int, int, int) that sets the number of dimensions to 1.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • PCMtoWAV

        public static void PCMtoWAV(OutputStream os,
                            byte[] pcmData,
                            int srate,
                            int channels,
                            int bitsPerSample,
                            int nDims)
                     throws IOException
        Write the PCM data to a stream in WAV format. Primarily this means writing the wav header followed by the actual PCM data. The stream is NOT closed on return.
        Parameters:
        os - stream to which the wav bytes are written. Not closed before returning.
        pcmData - raw PCM data (linear encoding).
        srate - sampling rate of PCM data.
        channels - number of channels, generally 1 or 2.
        bitsPerSample - bits per sample, generally 8 or 16.
        nDims - the number of dimensions of interleaved data in the give pcm data. Placed into a LIST/DIMS chunk for reading back by PCMtoWAV().
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        http://soundfile.sapp.org/doc/WaveFormat/

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IOException - if the byte array does not represent PCM wav.

        Returns:

        IOException

      • ReadPCM

        public static SoundClip ReadPCM(double startTimeMsec,
                                String fileOrURL,
                                String format)
                         throws IOException
        Read the SoundClip from the network or file using #ReadPCM(long,URL, String).
        Parameters:
        startTimeMsec - the start time of the returned clip.
        fileOrURL - string containing either a filename (absolute or relative) or a url.
        format - see #ReadPCM(long, URL, String).
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        IOException
        IllegalArgumentException - if format is not recognized or could not be determined.

        Returns:

      • ReadPCM

        public static SoundClip ReadPCM(double startTimeMsec,
                                URL url,
                                String format)
                         throws IOException
        Read a SoundClip from the given URL. Supported formats are WAV and MP3.
        Parameters:
        startTimeMsec - the start time of the returned clip.
        url - file or network url.
        format - one of "mp3" or "wav" or null. If null, then try and determine the format from the url.
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        IOException
        IllegalArgumentException - if format is not recognized or could not be determined.

      • WAVtoPCM

        public static SoundClip WAVtoPCM(InputStream is)
                          throws IOException
        Read a byte array from the stream (until EOF) which represent a PCM encoded wav file into a SoundClip with the start time set to 0. Stream is not closed.
        Parameters:
        is -
        Returns:
        never null
        Throws:
        IOException - if the byte array does not represent PCM wav.

      • WAVtoPCM

        public static SoundClip WAVtoPCM(double startTimeMsec,
                                 byte[] wave)
                          throws IOException
        Convert the given byte array which represent a PCM encoded wav file into a SoundClip.
        Parameters:
        wav - byte array from which to read wav formatted PCM. Not used in the returned value.
        Returns:
        never null
        Throws:
        IOException - if the byte array does not represent PCM wav.

      • double2PCM

        public static byte[] double2PCM(double[] data,
                                int channels,
                                int bitsPerSample)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                RuntimeException
        Scale array of doubles in the range -1..1 to an array of PCM bytes.
        Parameters:
        data - data to put in return byte array. Values are centered around 0 for all values of bitsPerSample.
        channels - number of channels in the output array.
        bitsPerSample - bits per sample to use in the output array
        Returns:
        an array of length intData.length * channels * bitsPerSample/8. Values are in unsigned 8 bit for bitsPerSample=8, and signed for all others, per wav file specification.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        RuntimeException
